column5: Well I finally decided what I would do with my last plaque I had made last fall.... since creating a lot of wooden lures, thought to display them on it and said to myself, why not.... here's the result:  Enjoy!!! Leechman    Another shot    ******************************************************************************** ********* UPDATE ******************************************************************************** *********  Here's a shot on the wall - closeup    and amongst the others    Leechman
awsome man for the top water baits do you need to use a lath?
TRES COOL !!!!  Great handy work!!  Next time you go out , you don't even have to bring your tackle box... just bring the plaque!!!  GREAT JOB!!   RFS
Looks real good Jacques!!!  ... but you can't use those lures for  if they're hangin' on the wall!... or is that and excuse to make more to feed your addiction?
HOLY MOLY!  great plaques jaques!  did you hit the ice yet dude?!?!  im not having any luck yet...  31 mile lake is not forzen yet and mcbay is mc dead.  what about lake lemay anyting there?!?!?

Thanks walleye_man!!!  No need for lath.... do it from scratch with a dremel.   Merci Randy!!!  Oh don't worry..... I have backup ones for that   Thanks Glen!!!  They sure won't get any use but I have a backup plan.... check them out    Thanks Kevin!!!  Yes I did hit the hard stuff a few times and no luck either..... but it's just a matter of time.... not much safe ice anywhere so far but it's getting there
nice work leech now all that is left is to catch a nice bigmouth ill wait for the pics
I'm looking forward to putting a largemouth on the wall, maybe a big bowfin that I might catch next year, and the small Gar Pike i caught in 08...  It looks nice Leechman keep up the good work, MTBF

Thanks Corvy!!!  only 5 months to wait for a tryout and maybe some pics   Thanks Mike!!! Yes that gar was something else.... would definitely look nice on the wall     If you have a lot of pics of it and good measurements, get a replica done.
